instruction.value: Initial Dose: Start at lower dose for at least 5 minutes. Increase by increments of 0.3 to 0.6 mg/kg/hour over 5 to 10 minutes until desired level of sedation is reached.
Administer by continuous infusion; maintenance dose.
Administer by direct injection every 30 to 60 seconds until target sedation level achieved.
Initial Dose: Start at 0.3 mg/kg/hour for at least 5 minutes. Increase by increments of 0.3 to 0.6 mg/kg/hour over 5 to 10 minutes until desired level of sedation is reached.
Initial dose: Administer by direct injection over 1 to 2 minutes. Up to a MAXIMUM dose of 40 mg.
Maintenance Dose: Administer by direct injection. Up to a MAX dose of 20 mg administered every 45 seconds or longer.
Administer by continuous infusion. Titrate to desired clinical effect and minimal hypotension. A minimum period of 5 minutes between dosage adjustments to be allowed for peak drug effect.
Initial dose: Administer over 3 to 5 minutes.

population.value: ADULT sedation in critical care areas. Maximum rate should not exceed 5 mg/kg/hour, due to potential cardiac toxicity.

ADULT procedural sedation (55 years or less, ASA Class I or II). Maximum rate should not exceed 5 mg/kg/hour, due to potential cardiac toxicity. Maintenance infusion: 1.5 to 4.5 mg/kg/hour. Reduce dose and rate by 20 to 30% in geriactric, debilitated and/or ASA Class II or IV patients.

INFANTS / CHILDREN: Critical care sedation; patients older than 3 months. Propofol has been used safely in hemodynamically stable, non-acidotic patients older than 3 months of age, with a MAX mean dose of 4 mg/kg/hour, for a MAX duration of 24 hours, when judged to be the optimal therapy under the circumstances.
INFANTS / CHILDREN: Procedural sedation. MAXIMUM dose: 40 mg.
